profileAlternative.name: Bartosz Milewski
profileAlternative.headline: Software Architect
profileAlternative.summary:
I have extensive experience as a software designer and developer, but I'm more of an architect and a visionary. I can help create successful software products. I also like the theoretical side of computer science, and have pretty good knowledge of category theory.

Specialties: Systems software architecture, design, and implementation. Extensive C++ programming expertise. Concurrent and parallel programming in a variety of languages. Distributed systems. Haskell and functional programming. Category theory.

I have a Ph.D. and did research in Quantum Physics before I switched to programming. I have experience in almost every aspect of software design and implementation.

I was a development lead at Microsoft, designing and implementing the Content Index--a search engine before its time. I founded Reliable Software, the maker of a distributed version control system, which I designed and developed with a team of C++ programmers. I open sourced it on GitHub (https://github.com/BartoszMilewski/CodeCoop)

I was Software Architect at FP Complete, where I created the School of Haskell (https://www.schoolofhaskell.com/), a site for publishing content with runnable and editable snippets of Haskell code.

I write a popular programming blog at http://BartoszMilewski.com, have a Haskell blog and tutorials at https://www.fpcomplete.com/user/bartosz , and two video series about parallelism and concurrency: one in C++11 http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1835A90FC78FF8BE , and one in Haskell https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbgaMIhjbmEm_51-HWv9BQUXcmHYtl4sw .

Together with Walter Bright and Andrei Alexandrescu I was involved in the the early stages of the design and implementation of the D programming language and its support for concurrency.

I published the book "C++ In Action" (Addison Wesley 2001) and an online book "Category Theory for Programmers."

positions.title: President and Founder
positions.description: Dividing time between running the company and designing and developing the product

positions.title: Software Architect
positions.description:
Architected the School of Haskell, a site for publishing and managing content with embedded runnable and editable snippets of Haskell code. Created the vision and functional specification, designed the UI, popularized the site and attracted community leaders to contribute articles and tutorials.

Architected the Haskell IDE.
…
see more

positions.title: Technical Evangelist
positions.description: Increasing the visibility and prestige of the company.

positions.title: President
positions.description: NWCPP meets every month. Regular speakers are Andrei Alexandrescu, Scott Meyers, Herb Sutter, just to mention a few.

positions.title: Lecturer
positions.description: I taught a Computer Graphics course

positions.title: Microsoft
positions.description: Managed the design and implementation of the Microsoft desktop search engine.

positions.title:
Title
Development Lead
positions.description: Managed the design and implementation of the Microsoft desktop search engine.

positions.title:
Title
SDE
positions.description: Work on operating systems (porting the Mach OS to the 386), file systems, and Windows shell

positions.title: Professor
positions.description: Teaching courses in Supersymmetry and Supergravity. Research in High Energy Physics.

given.text: I worked with Bartosz for several years. He's the sort of engineer every team needs - smart, focused, no compromises on quality, someone you can trust to do the job right the first time. He sets high standards for his work and is always encouraging others do the same.

received.text: Anthony was the best manager I've ever had. He was focused on creating a good product and building a great team. He was technically savvy but avoided micro-managing. He encouraged creativity but kept focus on deliverables. He didn't have a big ego and avoided work politics. These are the qualities one would expect from every manager but which, in corporate environments, are extremely rare.

Wieslaw was involved in all aspects of software design and development at Reliable Software. He designed and implemented several components of our version control system, Code Co-op. He is a very experienced C++ programmer with high quality standards.

items: Method and mechanism for freeing disk space in a file system
Method and system for effectively representing query results in alimited amount of memory
Scope testing of documents in a search engine using document to foldermapping
Method and system for automatically indexing data in a document using afresh index table
C++ In Action, Industrial Strength Programming Techniques

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Crazy about C++ passionate bug preventer and meticulous code reviewer. Active Member of C++ Community.
